alert.note: Alert for Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 9:15PM MDT until further notice by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Glasgow MT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Glasgow affecting Valley County. .Warm temperatures will melt the existing snowpack, leading to increased runoff and river flows. For the Milk River...including Saco, Tampico, Malta, Dodson, Glasgow, Nashua...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River at Glasgow. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, This is flood stage. Expect some low-land flooding to occur. At 29.0 feet, Water begins to flow over Whately Road...which is about 7 miles east of Glasgow. Baseball field at Sullivan Park flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 21.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning and continue rising to a crest of 30.9 feet early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 30.9 feet on 03/29/1899. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1000 AM MDT.
